00100 namespace ximpl_fast_integers
00101 {
00102     template <typename I>
00103     struct integer_shim
00104     {
00105     public:
00106         typedef I                                                       integer_type;
00107     private:
00108         typedef ss_typename_type_k stlsoft::integral_printf_traits<I>   traits_type_;
00109 
00110     public:
00111         enum
00112         {
00113             N = (1 + traits_type_::size_max)
00114         };
00115 
00116     public:
00117         ff_char_t const*    ptr;
00118         ff_char_t           buff[N];
00119         size_t              len;
00120 
00121     public:
00122         integer_shim()
00123         {}
00124 
00125         integer_shim(integer_shim const& rhs)
00126             : ptr(&buff[0] + (rhs.ptr - &rhs.buff[0]))
00127             , len(rhs.len)
00128         {
00129             ::memcpy(const_cast<ff_char_t*>(ptr), rhs.ptr, sizeof(ff_char_t) * len);
00130         }
00131 
00132     public:
00133         void assign(ff_char_t const* p)
00134         {
00135             this->ptr = p;
00136         }
00137 
00138     public:
00139         ff_char_t const*    data() const
00140         {
00141             return ptr;
00142         }
00143         size_t              size() const
00144         {
00145             return len;
00146         }
00147     };
00148 
00149 # if defined(STLSOFT_CF_BUILTIN_long_long_SUPPORT)
00150     typedef signed long long    ff_fi_sint64_t;
00151     typedef unsigned long long  ff_fi_uint64_t;
00152 # elif defined(STLSOFT_CF_64BIT_INT_SUPPORT)
00153     typedef ::stlsoft::sint64_t ff_fi_sint64_t;
00154     typedef ::stlsoft::uint64_t ff_fi_uint64_t;
00155 # else /* ? 64-bit / long long */
00156 #  error Bad discrimination
00157 # endif /* 64-bit / long long */
00158 
00159 
00160 } /* namespace ximpl_fast_integers */
00161 
00162 #endif /* !FASTFORMAT_DOCUMENTATION_SKIP_SECTION */
00163 
00164 /* /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00165  * Overloadable conversion shim functions:
00166  *
00167  * 64-bit/long long signed
00168  * 64-bit/long long unsigned
00169  * long signed
00170  * long unsigned
00171  * int signed
00172  * int unsigned
00173  * short signed
00174  * short unsigned
00175  */
00176 
00177 #if defined(STLSOFT_CF_BUILTIN_long_long_SUPPORT) || \
00178     defined(STLSOFT_CF_64BIT_INT_SUPPORT)
00179 
00184 inline
00185 ximpl_fast_integers::integer_shim<
00186     ximpl_fast_integers::ff_fi_sint64_t
00187 >
00188 filter_type(
00189     ximpl_fast_integers::ff_fi_sint64_t value
00190 ,   ximpl_fast_integers::ff_fi_sint64_t const*
00191 ,   ff_char_t const volatile*
00192 )
00193 {
00194     ximpl_fast_integers::integer_shim<ximpl_fast_integers::ff_fi_sint64_t> r;
00195 
00196     r.assign(stlsoft::integer_to_string(r.buff, STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(r.buff), value, r.len));
00197 
00198     return r;
00199 }
00200 
00205 inline
00206 ximpl_fast_integers::integer_shim<
00207     ximpl_fast_integers::ff_fi_uint64_t
00208 >
00209 filter_type(
00210     ximpl_fast_integers::ff_fi_uint64_t value
00211 ,   ximpl_fast_integers::ff_fi_uint64_t const*
00212 ,   ff_char_t const volatile*
00213 )
00214 {
00215     ximpl_fast_integers::integer_shim<ximpl_fast_integers::ff_fi_uint64_t> r;
00216 
00217     r.assign(stlsoft::integer_to_string(r.buff, STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(r.buff), value, r.len));
00218 
00219     return r;
00220 }
00221 
00222 #endif /* STLSOFT_CF_BUILTIN_long_long_SUPPORT || STLSOFT_CF_64BIT_INT_SUPPORT */
00223

00387 template <typename I>
00388 #ifdef FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00389 inline
00390 wchar_t const*
00391 c_str_data_w(
00392 #else /* ? FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00393 inline
00394 char const*
00395 c_str_data_a(
00396 #endif /* !FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00397 #if !defined(FASTFORMAT_NO_NAMESPACE)
00398     ::fastformat::filters::
00399 #endif /* !FASTFORMAT_NO_NAMESPACE */
00400         ximpl_fast_integers::integer_shim<I> const& s
00401 )
00402 {
00403 #if 1
00404     return s.data();
00405 #else /* ? 0 */
00406     return s.ptr;
00407 #endif /* 0 */
00408 }
00409
